Description: Axe-head: with two lugs. It is thin in section and not carefully fashioned. It is quite thickly corroded and is pitted in parts. It bears grinding marks and there are signs of wear on the cutting edge. Preserved in the corrosion on one face are traces of what may have been matting or basket-work.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (25)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
